Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone
Reviews.Author: JELT
Reviews.Content: Excellent, excellent phone!!Everything has worked just beautifully.  Easy to operate and configure (run into a little trouble with HSPA settings, but it turned out to be more a problem with some service provider settings than something wrong with the phone).Sound quality, as usual with SE phones, excellent.  As far as sound goes it is better then IPhone4 and waaaay better than any BB.Configuring DLNA with my PS3 and Bravia TV was really easy and works beatifully.Tons of apps available through Android Market.Swaps between HSPA and WIFI instantly when it connects to WIFI.Camera works well even in bad lighting conditions.Only downside found so far is that battery life is a little short (a day and a half in average)  but its something that you sort of expect with this kind of phone (I had similar battery life with an IPhone 4 and a BB).  I found a longer lasting battery that fits the phone on ebay.  Still waiting for it to arrive.  (I will update the review once I evaluate it)Quick shipping, well packed.Overall great service experience both from Amazon and JR.

Reviews.Title: Best low-tier high end Android phone on the market
Reviews.Author: SINnWo
Reviews.Content: This phone isn't your dual core powerhouse, but it is without a doubt the best low-tier high end Android phone on the market.  It's got everything you need (WiFi, Bluetooth, DLNA build in, Front facing video camera, fast processor, plenty of ram - 512mb, and a perfect size screen for multimedia viewing/games/browsing.  Not to mention, this phone has style and isn't the traditional large screened black brick.  It fits comfortably in the hand with it's unique curvature and it easy to operate with one hand (you can reach each corner of the screen with ease).  The phone ships with Android 2.3.3 (gingerbread) with an upgrade available now to 2.3.4 (gingerbread) and Sony Ericsson has confirmed that Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) will be hitting all of their 2011 phones (including this one).  So it's future-proof for the immediate future.  It's also not loaded with a bunch of bloatware and can have the boot loader unlocked with ease.  All in all it's a great phone, fully featured, light on price!  I have enjoyed it so far!

Reviews.Title: MT15a Xperia Neo
Reviews.Author: sonyzreal
Reviews.Content: I have been enjoying this phone since I got it. Almost everyday i find something cool about it. I love it!!The only issue which is not such a big deal is the battery life.

Reviews.Title: Two words....(GET IT)
Reviews.Author: Sntgber
Reviews.Content: Just got this phone through fedex the other day, fast and reliable shipping. O, and it arrived in one piece, how I like my new online purchases :D.Easy to sync with my carrier and transfer my previous data and contacts to this baby.Phone is fast in processing with only the one 1Ghz and has a dynamic screen for viewing videos and sliding away at your pictures. Camera is also well above average and much more powerful in mega pics than most smartphones.If your looking into getting an amazing piece of technology, consider it, trust me. It will make your daily life a whole lot easier. Apple is great too but for half the price you can get everything the iphone does, maybe even, in my opinion, a few other things much better.Enjoy. Hope this helps.power to the shoppers!

Reviews.Title: the product is good the seller doesnt give the hd cable
Reviews.Author: victor montiel
Reviews.Content: is good the cell but it doesnt came in a original box and they dont gave you the hd cable it sucks!!

Reviews.Title: Good phone, but why is it set up for South America, and sold in the USA?
Reviews.Author: Brett Paul Bellmore
Reviews.Content: The phone itself I like a great deal. Basically everything I was expecting, I've had a good experience before with Sony Ericsson products. Looks good, nice tactile feedback on the buttons. (Stiff enough you're not likely to actuate them by mistake.) Fantastic display and camera, and good sound quality. Haven't had a chance to test reception yet.Just slipped in the sim card from my old phone, and it worked fine. Though I did have to import the contacts one at a time off the card, which made no sense.Downsides:It arrived, in the USA, preset for Portuguese, and with a bunch of pre-loaded South American telecom apps I can't get rid of short of rooting it., which I'm looking into doing.Removing the back to install a sim card or memory card requires applying enough force to make one nervous about causing damage. I suppose that's better than my last phone, which had the back fall off on a regular basis.No manual accompanied it, just a generic "How to start your Android phone" pamphlet, which wasn't even accurate, I suppose because it had already been started.The charger has a plug assembly for insertion into the wall which is absurdly bulky. Why is it I can get a tiny one at the gas station, and the phone comes with one that sticks out 3 inches from the wall?

Reviews.Title: LOVED IT THEN AND STILL LOVE NOW!!!
Reviews.Author: Oscar Otaiza
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone 2 years ago and still being one of my best purchase ever! I still have it and i'll have it until it breaks (Maybe i'll never happen). It's beautifull, great performance, nice interface, great camera (Even Better than iPhone 4s), the Screen resolution could be better but hey! i have 2 years with it!.I totally loved it then and i still love it now!P.D: Works great with a SD Card of 32Gb.100% Recomended!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Gener
Reviews.Content: I really like this phone because it has everything I need. I can not stop talking about his excellent camera and the amount of q is Android apps

Reviews.Title: Very good phone
Reviews.Author: S. Dato
Reviews.Content: This is a very good phone and it has a very good price.Pros:-Android 2.3 and future upgrade to ICS.-Good screen.-micro SD card.-HDMI.-Good CameraCons:-No enough internal memory.-Battery life.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone
Reviews.Author: Rafael Mateo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good phone for basic functions such as emailing, browsing and chatting. But If you are a hardcore user (tons of apps) then look something else, because you will notice the lagging after a while (I am a hardcore user and it is getting pretty slow after 6 months of use. I have a lot of apps).My only complaint would be that it is a little bulky and battery life is short (around 6-7 hours, normal use, low brightness).Why the five stars? because for the price, the phone is beautiful, doesnt feel cheap and it performs well as long as you use it only for the basics. Also, Sony Ericsson will upgrade it to Ice Cream Sandwich.

Reviews.Title: CELULAR
Reviews.Author: PAME
Reviews.Content: El equipo es increíble mejor de lo que pensaba, no es ni muy delgado ni muy ancho, tiene un buen procesador y gran capacidad de almacenamiento.

Reviews.Title: Awesome cellphone
Reviews.Author: Akath19
Reviews.Content: This phone is an amazing product, it can easily stand up to more expensive phones such as the Samsung Galaxy S or any of the HTC phones, it also has an amazing battery (I came from a Samsung Galaxy Mini and that battery was awful), the only problem of this phone is that the camera could be a little bit better, but hopefully that will be addressed once SE updates the Xperia 2011 line to Ice Cream Sandwich

Wireless-N Wi-Fi networking, Bluetooth stereo music, GPS navigation, 1 GB memory, microSD expansion
Up to 7 hours of talk time, up to 400 hours (16.67 days) of standby time, released in March, 2011
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, USB/wall charger, USB cable, wired stereo headset, quick start guide
3.7" Multi-touch Display with Sony Bravia Engine
8.1 MP Camera
Android 2.3 Gingerbeard
It has 3.7" Multi-touch Display with Sony Bravia Engine
It has 8.1 MP Camera, Android 2.3 Gingerbeard
Multiple E-mail Support (Webmail and ActiveSync), Internet and Wifi Capable, Bluetooth 2.1
Not compatible with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint
UMTS-HSPA 800/850/1900/2100, GSM-GPRS/EDGE 850/900/1800/1900
